category_name.fr_FR: appareils de sauvegarde de données de téléphones portables

category_description.en_US:
A LED-TV is a flat panel display that uses LED backlighting instead of the cold cathode fluorescent (CCFL) backlighting used in most other LCDs. Three forms of LED may be used:

- White edge-LEDs around the rim of the screen, using a special diffusion panel to spread the light evenly behind the screen (the most usual form)

- An array of LEDs arranged behind the screen whose brightness are not controlled individually.

- A dynamic “local dimming” array of LEDs to achieve a modulated backlight light pattern
Options available for mobile data subscriptions e.g. how many megabytes (MB) or gigabytes (GB) per month, what type of mobile device (smartphone, tablet) you can have with the subscription.
category_name.fr_FR: options d'appareils de sauvegarde de données de téléphones portables

category_description.en_US: Temporary structure on the outside of a building, made of wooden planks and metal poles, used by workmen while building, repairing, or cleaning the building.
Devices which play Blu-Ray Discs. Used in home entertainment and home cinema systems to play films.
These are blank Blu-Ray Discs (BDs) onto which you can store data e.g. films.
Accessories used for hair care and makeup such as brushes.
category_name.fr_FR: accessoires de maquillage et soin des cheveux

category_description.en_US: Services for the transport of goods and services.
Fees (money) paid to service providers for maintenance and support of hardware, software etc.
Power tool used for turning screws.
Device which produces high volumes of data discs e.g. DVDs, CDs.
Also known as a side grinder or disc grinder, this is a handheld power tool used for cutting, grinding and polishing.
Power tools used to smooth surfaces by abrasion with sandpaper.

A punch is a hard metal rod with a shaped tip at one end and a blunt butt end at the other, which is usually struck by a hammer.A nail set is a nail punch which is used to drive the head of a nail level to or into a surface.
Tool used to remove the protective casing from electrical wire so connections can be made.

A nut driver is a tool for tightening nuts and bolts, which is similar in appearance and use to a screwdriver. A nut driver bit is detachable 'socket' of various sizes which attaches to the shaft and cylindrical handle of the nut driver.
Terminal box for electric wiring or fittings at which the wires terminate for connection to electric fixtures or appliances.
An electrical connection is where objects join to make a circuit e.g. plug from a device which connects to the mains electricity plug socket.

A coaxial RF connector is an electrical connector designed to work at radio frequencies in the multi-megahertz range. RF connectors are typically used with coaxial cables and are designed to maintain the shielding that the coaxial design offers.
Analog circuits which perform signal processing functions, specifically to remove unwanted frequency components from the signal, to enhance wanted ones, or both.

Number locks ('num locks') are keys on a computer keyboard. When they are switched on, some keys can be used to produce numbers. When switched off, these same keys have different functions e.g. they work as arrow keys for the cursor.

Antistatic device worn on the wrist  used to safely ground a person working on very sensitive electronic equipment, to prevent the buildup of static electricity on their body, which can result in electrostatic discharge (ESD).
Sprays and other chemicals used to prevent the build up of dust on surfaces.
Caps used to protect electronic conenctors to prevent them from getting damaged.
Components used in laser printers and photocopiers to
Accessories for tripods, which are three-legged camera stands, such as spare legs and stand components.
Movies or films which are stored on Blu-Ray (BD) or DVD.
Instrument that converts user information into signals or reconverts received signals.
Devices which split a single cable into more than one cable, or combines several cables into one cable.
A switch box that routes an input signal to an output line e.g. to connect several computers to a single printer.
Electronic device used to check the electrical connections in a network cable.
A console is a device used to monitor and control a network. A console extender is a devices which allow remote access to this console.
Device with multiple or multi-purpose connections,used for telecommunications equipment.
Network device used by telecom carriers to switch high-speed optical signals e.g.OC-3, OC-12, OC-48.
category_name.fr_FR: équipements de croisement de connection optique

category_description.en_US: Services which fix and repair manufacturing equipment.

Small portable telescope with added optics to present an erect image, optimized for the observation of terrestrial objects. They are used for birdwatching and other naturalist activities, for hunting, verifying a marksman's shots, surveillance, and for any other application that requires more magnification than a pair of binoculars, typically on the order of 20× to 60×.
Liquid cooling is a highly effective method of removing excess heat from computers which is generated by the electronic components.

Computer programs used to track and store electronic documents. It is usually also capable of keeping track of the different versions modified by different users (history tracking). The term has some overlap with the concepts of content management systems. It is often viewed as a component of enterprise content management (ECM) systems and related to digital asset management, document imaging, workflow systems and records management systems.

An adapter is a physical device that allows one hardware or electronic interface to be adapted (accommodated without loss of function) to another hardware or electronic interface. A remote management adapter allows you to manage systems remotely.

Content delivery networks use multiple servers in many geographic locations that improve deliveries of static and streaming content. Global content requests automatically get routed to the closest servers, speeding up page loads, maximizing bandwidth and providing identical content regardless of Internet- or site-traffic spikes. Depending on traffic and number of nodes, the network's algorithms select the best routing options to deliver optimum performance and avoid bottlenecks. Equipment to create content delivery networks include servers and storage systems.
category_name.fr_FR: équipements de réseau de distribution de contenu

category_description.en_US: Devices used in home and office to measure temperature and other weather conditions.
Accessories for portable bar code readers.
category_name.fr_FR: accessoires pour lecteur de code barres

category_description.en_US: Watches designed for sports purposes. Usually include a stopwatch and other measuring devices. Often tough and waterproof or water resistant.
Machine using a toothed metal cutting disc or blade. Mostly used to cut wood.
Device which removes the moisture from fruit to make dryed fruit.
Household appliances used to make crepes (pancakes).
Household appliance used for grilling cheese and other food.
Devices that change the electrical or light characteristics of a signal.
Set of electrical connectors, which are electro-mechanical devices for joining electrical circuits as an interface.

Headsets are headphone or headphones combined with a microphone. Headsets provide the equivalent functionality of a telephone handset but with hands-free operation. They have many uses including in call centers and other telephone-intensive jobs and for anybody wishing to have both hands free during a telephone conversation.
Cables used to transfer information between two devices using a parallel communication protocol. These cables usually have IEEE 1284 connectors.
Cables used to transfer information between two devices using a serial communication protocol.

Also known as a vision mixer, video switcher or production switcher, this is a device used to select between several different video sources and in some cases mixing video sources together to create special effects.
Tool for tightening nuts and bolts. It essentially consists of a socket attached to a shaft and cylindrical handle and is similar in appearance and use to a screwdriver.
Devices which split a single telephone line into more than one line.
Devices which allow the management of a computer network.

Pairs of glasses which allow 2D images to be perceived as 3D. They present two offset images separately to the left and right eye of the viewer. These two-dimensional images are then combined in the brain to give the perception of 3D depth.
Computer program used to make charts and graphs of numerical data.
Also known as a steamer, this is a kitchen appliance which cooks food using steam (water vapor).
Also known as a popcorn maker, this is a machine used for popping popcorn.
Small plastic, wooden or metal containers for pepper or salt, with small blades used for grinding the peppercorns or salt flakes so they can be added to food.
Machine used to make ice cubes.
Machine used for making candy floss (cotton candy).
Device used to dry nails following the application of nail varnish or lacquer.

An Internet Protocol (IP) phone, also known as a VoIP phone (Voice over IP) uses technologies for placing and transmitting telephone calls over an IP network, such as the Internet, instead of the traditional public switched telephone network (PSTN).

Video telephone and other devices used for setting up and delivering video conferencing, which is where two or more separate locations communicate by simultaneous two-way video and audio transmissions.
Objects into which baby feeding bottles are placed and then sterilized using steam.
Kitchen drawers which have compartments for keeping food warm until it is served.
Computer program which is used for browsing, installing and uninstalling fonts.
Device for heating an enclosed area, which is usually a small space. Space heaters are usually portable or wall-mounted, and are powered by electricity, natural gas or propane.
Long, narrow board covered with soft material and folding legs, on which clothes, sheets, etc. are ironed.

Display of many colours, either physically on a piece of paper or on a digital format. Used for colour comparisons and measurements such as checking the colour reproduction of an imaging system, and calibration and/or profiling of digital input devices such as digital cameras, and scanners and output display systems like printers, monitors and projectors.

Light-emitting diode (LED) product that is assembled into a lamp (or light bulb) for use in lighting fixtures. LED lamps have a lifespan and electrical efficiency that is several times better than incandescent lamps, and significantly better than most fluorescent lamps, with some chips able to emit more than 100 lumens per watt.
Equipment used to create a cellular wireless (mobile phone and internet) network such as antennas.
Cooking appliance used in the home to grill/fry hot dogs (sausages).
Heat-resistant piece of material, normally with an elasticated edge, used to cover an ironing board.
Also known as a gift token, this is a piece of paper which can be given to a shop, cinemas etc. in place of money. Often given as gifts for birthdays and special occasions.
Device for serving chocolate fondue (melted chocolate).

A doorbell is an electronic signaling device typically placed near an entry door to a building. When a visitor presses a button the bell rings inside the building, alerting the occupant to the presence of the visitor.

A personal FM transmitter is a low-power FM radio transmitter which purpose is to allow music or other audio content from a portable media player, CD player or other portable audio system to be played through a nearby FM radio.
Components such as timers and thermostats which control cooking devices.
category_name.fr_FR: modules de contrôle de la cuisinière

category_description.en_US: Airtight pot in which food can be cooked quickly under steam pressure.
Device that automatically regulates temperature, or that activates a device when the temperature reaches a certain point.
Services which manage the purchasing and delivery of products from suppliers (wholesalers) to physical and online retails.
POS (Point of Sale) or mobile printers are used to print receipts and other documents in retail.
category_name.fr_FR: imprimantes à reçu de point de vente

category_description.en_US: Sprays and powders used to repel and kill insects.
Fixed basin with a water supply (taps/faucets)and a drain, found in kitchens.
Electrical device allowing two-way communication between someone inside a building and someone at the front door.

Also known as a tap, this is device by which a flow of liquid or gas from a pipe or container can be controlled. Water faucets are found in kitchens and bathrooms. There can be separate cold and hot faucets or one that produces both cold and hot water.
Place for a domestic fire, especially a grate or hearth at the base of a chimney.

Filters used on cameras to modify the images recorded e.g. to change the colours or to make black-white images. The filter can be a square or oblong shape mounted in a holder accessory, or, more commonly, a glass or plastic disk with a metal or plastic ring frame, which can be screwed in front of or clipped onto the lens.
Speaker which produces bass sounds (low-pitched audio frequencies).
Accessories for the kitchen and house such as containers and cloths.

Sometimes referred to by the merchandising term personal video recorder (PVR),this is a consumer electronics device or application software that records video in a digital format to a disk drive, USB flash drive, SD memory card, SSD or other local or networked mass storage device. The term includes set-top boxes (STB) with direct to disk recording facility, portable media players (PMP) with recording, recorders (PMR) as camcorders that record onto Secure Digital memory cards and software for personal computers which enables video capture and playback to and from a hard disk drive.

Structure including metallic rod placed on top of buildings. If lightning strikes it will preferentially strike the rod and be conducted to ground through the wire, instead of passing through the structure, where it could start a fire or cause electrocution.
Devices that allow you to speak on the phone hands-free by using a speaker and  a microphone.
Device used to measure the amount of light. Commonly used by photographers.
Accessory for notebook computers that helps reduce their operating temperature.They are intended to protect both the notebook from overheating and the user from suffering heat-related discomfort.
category_name.fr_FR: systèmes de refroidissement pour ordinateurs portables

category_description.en_US: A type of soft lighting device used in photography. A "soft box" is an enclosure around a bulb comprising reflective side and back walls and a diffusing material at the front of the light. The sides and back of the box are lined with a bright surface - an aluminized fabric surface or an aluminum foil -  to act as an efficient reflector.
Electric device used to straighten hair. Also known as a hair iron or a hair tong.
Also known as dummies, these are plastic devices placed in babies' mouths to stop them crying and keep them happy.
A toy for babies who are teething (growing teeth).
Also known as a water cooler, this is piece of office equipment used for dispensing cold or cool water. The water can come from the mains or from a bottle which is attached to the dispenser.

Mechanical device that extracts milk from the breasts of a lactating woman. Breast pumps may be manual devices powered by hand or foot movements or electrical devices powered by electricity or batteries.
Appliance that increases humidity (moisture) in a single room or in an entire building. Commonly used in artificially heated spaces.
Contains presents/gifts for babies such as soft toys.
Gving food to toddler, which is a child between 1-3 years old.
Creams and other products applied to skin to keep it clean and healthy.
category_name.fr_FR: produits de soins de la peau

category_description.en_US: Depilation - removal of body or facial hair from its root - using light.

Also known as phototherapy, light therapy consists of exposure to daylight or to specific wavelengths of light using polychromatic polarised light, lasers, light-emitting diodes, fluorescent lamps, dichroic lamps or very bright, full-spectrum light, usually controlled with various devices. The light is administered for a prescribed amount of time and, in some cases, at a specific time of day. It can be used in the treatment of skin disorders, sleep disorder and some psychiatric disorders.
Devices which allow e-mails to be stored and archived separately so that they free up space on the hard disk and so that they are stored safely.
Devices which check how the network is running and ensure that it is running at its most efficient (optimum).
category_name.fr_FR: appareils d'optimisation et de contrôle des réseaux

category_description.en_US: Printer emulation allows printers to emulate other printers. For example, if a non-HP printer emulates an HP printer, any software written for a real HP printer will also run in the non-HP printer emulation and produce equivalent printing. Printer emulation upgrades means updating the software so that it is the latest version.
category_name.fr_FR: mises à jour des émulations d'imprimantes

category_description.en_US: These are lights used in discos, clubs and other venues for flashing, different colours and other effects.
Optical instrument used for viewing very small objects, such as mineral samples or animal or plant cells, typically magnified several hundred times.
Lenses, plates and other accessories for microscopes.
Small binoculars used to see things from a long distance e.g. for watching the opera in a theatre.
Tool used for cutting arbitrary curves, such as stenciled designs or other custom shapes, into a piece of wood, metal, or other material.

Also known as a  hammer drill, roto-drill or hammering drill, a hammer drill is a rotary drill with a hammering action. The hammering action provides a short, rapid hammer thrust to destroy relatively brittle material and allow quicker drilling with less effort. These tools are usually electrically powered, and increasingly powered by batteries.
Device that measures distance from the observer to a target. Commonly used in photography and engineering.
Mixers and food processors are used to chop, mix and puree food. They have various attachments such as blades and mills.
An audio CD (compact disc) is used to record and store audio content such as music or speech. Played back using a CD player or CD drive in a computer etc.

Radio that can both transmit and receive. A two-way radio allows the operator to have a conversation with other similar radios operating on the same radio frequency (channel). Two-way radios are available in mobile, stationary base and hand-held portable configurations. Hand-held radios are often called walkie-talkies.

Optical instrument designed to make distant objects appear nearer. It contains an arrangement of lenses, or of curved mirrors and lenses, by which rays of light are collected and focused and the resulting image magnified.
Chemical used to remove limescale from kettles, taps, baths etc.

Also known as a security token, this is a device used to prove one's identity electronically e.g. when accessing a bank account. The authenticator is used in addition to or in place of a password to prove that the user is who they claim to be.
Computer program that allows you to manage a service such as online retail.
Appliances to make chocolate at home.

Electrical kitchen device used for slicing foods. An electric knife requires less physical effort than an ordinary knife and produces neater slices. The device consists of two serrated blades that are clipped together. When the appliance is switched on the blades continuously move lengthways to provide the sawing action.
Appliances to make yogurt at home.
Device with multiple ports which allows separate computers to display their video outputs on a single screen.
Device that allows power to be controlled remotely.

Also known as a mixing console, sound board, mixing desk, and audio production console, an audio mixer is an electronic device for combining ("mixing"), routing, and changing the level, timbre and/or dynamics of audio signals. A mixer can mix analog or digital signals, depending on the type of mixer. The modified signals (voltages or digital samples) are summed to produce the combined output signals.
Small piece of plastic used to cover the lens of a camera to protect it from scratches and dirt.
Printers which print on blank plastic cards to produce bespoke designs.
Plastic cards with nothing printed on them. Used in plastic card printers to produce bespoke cards.

Plastic gun which uses a continuous heating element to melt plastic glue, which may be pushed through the gun by a mechanical trigger mechanism, or directly by the user. The glue squeezed out of the heated nozzle is initially hot enough to burn and blister skin. The glue is tacky when hot, and solidifies in a few seconds to one minute.
Power tool which can be used for various cutting tasks with various materials.
Object or device for producing musical sounds e.g guitar, violin.

Stringed musical instrument, with a fretted fingerboard, typically incurved sides, and six or twelve strings, played by plucking or strumming with the fingers or a plectrum. Can be acoustic or electric.

Percussion instrument sounded by being struck with sticks or the hands, typically cylindrical, barrel-shaped, or bowl-shaped, with a taut membrane over one or both ends. Often played with other drums in a collection known as a drum kit.
Also known as rubbish bins or trash cans, this is a container for waste.
Kitchen utensil with a broad, flat blade for lifting foods such as cake and fish.
Cleaning device that uses ultrasound (usually from 20–400 kHz) and an appropriate cleaning solvent (sometimes ordinary tap water) to clean delicate items e.g. jewellery, electronics.
Cleaning appliances or devices that use steam to quickly dry, clean, and sanitize surfaces. Often the process is effective enough to disinfect or even sterilize the surfaces.
Coffee beans, ground coffee or coffee powder. Used to make coffee.
Instrument used to locate fish underwater by detecting reflected pulses of sound energy (sonar).
Devices used for heating water in homes and other buildings for hot water and heating systems.
Accessories for telescopes such as stands, tripods and cases.
Devices used in the home such as washing machines and fridges.
Allows you to adjust the temperature in an indoor space by heating or cooling the air.
Sewing means to join, fasten, or repair (something) by making stitches with a needle and thread or a sewing machine. sIroning means to smooth clothes, sheets, etc. with an iron.
These are objects and pieces of furniture found in the bathroom such as toilet bowls.
Tools used for gardening e.g. cutting and trimming plants and hedges, planting flower bulbs.
Machine that uses a revolving blade or blades to cut a lawn (grass) at an even height.

Tool which uses a flexible monofilament line instead of a blade for cutting grass and other plants near objects. It consists of a cutting head at the end of a long shaft with a handle or handles and sometimes a shoulder strap.

This is a mechanical or electronic timepiece used to assist in tracking the hours worked by an employee of a company. In the mechanical version, heavy paper card called a timesheet is inserted into a slot on the time clock. When the time card hits a contact at the rear of the slot, the machine prints day and time information on the card.

A tachograph is a device fitted to a vehicle that automatically records its speed and distance, together with the driver's activity selected from a choice of modes. For modern tachographs,the data is recorded digitally on a tachograph card, which is a digital card containing a microchip with flash memory. A tachograph card reader is a device that can read a tachograph card.

A smart card is a pocket-sized plastic card with embedded integrated circuits. Smart cards can provide identification, authentication, data storage and application processing. Smart card software is a computer program used to control and manage smart cards.

A smart card is a pocket-sized plastic card with embedded integrated circuits. Smart cards can provide identification, authentication, data storage and application processing. Smart card readers are devices which can read smart cards.
Object for a child to play with, typically a model or miniature replica of something.

RAID is a storage technology that combines multiple disk drive components into a logical unit for the purposes of data redundancy and performance improvement. Data is distributed across the drives in one of several ways, referred to as RAID levels, depending on the specific level of redundancy and performance required. A RIAD controller, which is a type of disk array controller, is a device which manages the physical disk drives and presents them to the computer as logical units.
Fine net hung across a door or window or around a bed to keep mosquitoes away.
Devices which control the speed of a fan.
Device to pump water from one place to another, used to drain flood water, clean ponds and pools or stop building foundations from becoming submerged.
Small clock worn  on a strap on one’s wrist. Can be analog, digital or new-generation smartwatch.
Object which is placed on the floor or attached to the ceiling or wall, used to hold a projector in place.
Object which supports a CPU (Central Processing Unit in a computer) and holds it in place.
Bracket or support used to hang a flat panel from the ceiling.
Accessories for wall and ceiling mounts such as screws, nuts and brackets.
category_name.fr_FR: accessoires de supports muraux et de plafonds

category_description.en_US: Accessories for water pumps such as pipes and hose connectors.

Device  that provides access to the system console of a computing device via networking technologies. Most commonly, a console server provides a number of serial ports, which are then connected to the serial ports of other equipment, such as servers, routers or switches. The consoles of the connected devices can then be accessed by connecting to the console server over a serial link such as a modem, or over a network with terminal emulator software such as telnet or ssh, maintaining survivable connectivity that allows remote users to log in the various consoles without being physically nearby.
Small components used in serial communication interfaces such as serial ports.
Also known as a terminal server, this is a device that enables you to connect devices with an RS-232, RS-422 or RS-485 serial interface to a local area network (LAN).
Radio frequency (RF) modems transmit radio waves wirelessly over a certain range, which can be tens of kilometres.

I/O refers to Input/Output, which is the transfer of data between the CPU and a peripheral device. I/O modules, which can be digital and analog, are self-contained components that interact between the CPU and peripherals.

A network switch is a computer networking device that is used to connect many devices together on a computer network. A network switch module is a self-contained hardware or software component that interfaces between a network switch and other devices.
Devices which work on cellular (mobile) networks.
Small beauty tools, shaped like tongs, applied to the eyelashs to give them curl.
Low-melting alloy, especially one based on lead and tin or (for higher temperatures) on brass or silver, used for joining less fusible metals with a soldering iron.

Also known as a multitester and a VOM (Volt-Ohm meter), this is an electronic measuring instrument that combines several measurement functions in one unit. A typical multimeter would include basic features such as the ability to measure voltage, current, and resistance.
Small electric household appliance used to vacuum dirt and dust from floors and carpets. Has a long handle, looks like a lightweight upright hoover.
Memory (RAM) built into the printer, which is used to store and process print jobs sent from the computer.

Also known as a fog machine or fog generator, this is a device that emits a dense vapor that appears similar to fog or smoke. This artificial fog is most commonly used in professional entertainment applications e.g. in nightclubs and discos.
Machine used to produce bubbles for children's entertainment.

Also known as a mirror ball or glitter ball, this is a roughly spherical object that reflects light directed at it in many directions, producing a complex display. Its surface consists of hundreds or thousands of facets, nearly all of approximately the same shape and size, and each having a mirrored surface. Usually it is mounted well above the heads of the people present, suspended from a device that causes it to rotate steadily on a vertical axis, and illuminated by spotlights, so that stationary viewers experience beams of light flashing over them, and see myriad spots of light spinning around the walls of the room.
Appliances for crushing ice so that it can be put into drinks or used for freezing food.
Device similar to an electric kettle, used for making tea.
Device which can create a vacuum seal in a plastic bag in order to keep the contents of the bag fresh.
Accessories for vacuum sealers such as bags and containers.
category_name.fr_FR: fournitures & accessoires d'appareils à emballage sous vide

category_description.en_US: Instrument which measures the working speed of an engine (especially in a road vehicle), typically in revolutions per minute.
Device which converts video signals/data into other types of signals/data, or vice versa.
Device for sharpening knives to make them cut more effectively.

A Network interface is a systems interface (software and/or hardware) between two pieces of equipment or protocol layers in a network. A network interface processor is a device which allows the network interface to operate.

Also known as a cash till, this is a mechanical or electronic device for calculating and recording sales transactions, and an attached drawer (storage space) for storing cash. The cash register also usually prints a receipt for the customer.

This is a component of a printer. With spooling, multiple processes can write documents to a print queue without waiting. As soon as a process has written its document to the spool device, the process can perform other tasks, while a separate printing process operates the printer.

This is a type of magnetic cartridge which converts mechanical vibrational energy from a stylus riding in a record groove into an electrical signal that is subsequently amplified and then converted back to sound by a loudspeaker system.

DECT is the system for creating cordless telephones for home use. DECT base stations are the units which are connected to the phone line and the places where cordless handsets are rested when not in use, in order to recharge their batteries.

Personal monitoring device which allows one to measure his or her heart rate in real time or record the heart rate for later study. It is largely used by performers of various types of physical exercise.
Lamps etc. found on the ceiling of buildings.
Lighting attached to indoor or outdoor walls.
Electronic components are devices in electronic systems.
Device which converts audio signals/data into other types of signals/data, or vice versa.
Small, often powerful, light which illuminates in a 'spotlight' effect.
Brushes used to clean the toilet bowl.
Lighting in a waterproof casing which is used underwater e.g. in swimming pools.
Lamps and bulbs above, below or to the side of mirrors and displays to improve visibility.
A transformer is a device for reducing or increasing the voltage of an alternating current. A lighting transformer is one which is used with lighting.
Thin coloured sheets placed over lights or camera lenses to produce different colours or shades.
Type of circuit for lighting which is connected in a ring.
Plastic or glass cover for a light, which is transparent or translucent to let the light through.
Accessories for lighting such as bulbs and cables.

Also known as a smoke alarm is a device that detects smoke, typically as an indicator of fire. Commercial, industrial, and mass residential devices issue a signal to a fire alarm system, while household detectors, known as smoke alarms, generally issue a local audible or visual alarm from the detector itself.
Also known as a punched pocket, this is a flat, slitted plastic bag with a perforated edge used to hold paper documents.
Small notepaper which can be stuck to a surface such as a board ot computer monitor without adhesive e.g. Post-It notes.
Small pads used for writing down phone messages.
category_name.fr_FR: blocs ou livres de messages téléphoniques
distributeurs de bande pour l'étanchéité de la boîte

category_description.en_US: Flexible plastic container an opening at the top, used for carrying things.
Flexible paper container an opening at the top, used for carrying things.
Hand-held machine used to drive heavy metal staples into wood, plastic, or masonry.

Stand-alone magnetic disk, optical disc or solid state drive that plugs into the computer typically via USB, although eSATA and FireWire are also used. Used for storing and retrieving digital information.
Device which sterilizes (cleans) using UV (ultra-violet light). Used to sterilize medical equipment etc.
White fluid that can be applied to paper to cover over errors in text. Once dried, it can be written over.
White fluid that which is added to a correction pen once the correction fluid has run out.
Small erasers found on the end of retractable/mechanical pens and pencils.

Used to correct mistakes during typing, or, in some forms, handwriting. One side of the tape, which is placed against the error, is coated in a white, opaque masking material. Pressure applied to the other side of the tape transfers this material to the paper.
Piece of soft rubber or plastic used to rub out (erase) something written.
Passive two-terminal electrical component used to store energy electrostatically in an electric field. Commonly used in electric circuits.
Connectors, washers etc. used in faucets (taps).

category_name.fr_FR: services médicaux d'urgence des produits de gestion des catastrophes

category_name.en_US: ultra density optical UDO blank disks
category_description.en_US: An Ultra Density Optical (UDO) disc is an optical disc format designed for high-density storage of high-definition video and data.
category_name.fr_FR: disques vierges ultra densité optique UDO

category_description.en_US: Cloth/material used for artistic purposes. Fabric supplies include paints and oils.
category_name.fr_FR: tissus d'art et matériel et fournitures de tissu de décoration

category_description.en_US: Long strip of cloth bearing a slogan or design, carried in a demonstration or procession or hung in a public place.

Component of a thermal transfer printer. In thermal transfer printing is a digital printing process in which material is applied to paper (or some other material) by melting a coating of ribbon so that it stays glued to the material on which the print is applied.

Common Interface (CI) is used in Digital Video Broadcasting. It means that the encrypted TV signal is read by a separate device with a pay-to-view card, rather than the TV itself.  A CI module allows the separate device to interface with the TV.  This allows manufacturers to install a single (common) interface into their devices rather than many. It is a similar concept to USB.

The part of a tripod system that attaches the supported device (such as a camera) to the tripod legs, and allows the orientation of the device to be manipulated or locked down. Modular or stand-alone tripod heads can be used on a wide range of tripods, allowing the user to choose which type of head best suits their needs. Integrated heads are built directly onto the tripod legs, reducing the cost of the tripod system.

Large interactive display that connects to a computer. A projector projects the computer's desktop onto the board's surface where users control the computer using a pen, finger, stylus, or other device. The board is typically mounted to a wall or floor stand. Used in schools and corporate meeting rooms.
Small mechanical/electrical tabel-top device for measuring time, indicating hours, minutes, and sometimes seconds by hands on a round dial or by displayed figures
Strip of leather, cloth, or other flexible material, used to fasten, secure, or carry something or to hold on to something e.g. watch, bag.
Notice on public display that gives information or instructions in a written or symbolic form.
Road signs indicating one-way roads etc.
Flags (pieces of patterned rectangular cloth used for identity purpose and for decoration) which can be stuck to a surface without needing additional adhesive (glue)
Accessories for security cameras such as cables and recording equipment.
category_name.fr_FR: supports et boîtiers des caméras de sécurité

category_description.en_US: These mats are designed to prevent the build up of static energy caused by wiping and scraping of the shoes. These mats are also well-suited in areas were electrical equipment and household appliances create and emit static charges.
Signs in offices, public spaces or industrial buildings giving safety advice such as 'wet floor' after the floor has been mopped.
High quality pair of pliers, usually with spring-loaded jaws, and in-built tools such as knives and can openers. Use on camping trips etc.
Instrument composed of a blade fixed into a handle, used for cutting or as a weapon.
Top part of a shower system, this is a a perforated nozzle that sprays water.
Telescopic sight on a rifle used to see targets from far away.
Supplies for hand tools such as blades for hand saws.
Device consisting of a strip of wire that melts and breaks an electric circuit if the current exceeds a safe level.
The product can be added onto an IP system e.g. to increase the number of phone lines
A manual screwdriver is  tool with a flattened or cross-shaped tip that fits into the head of a screw to turn it by hand. Screwdriver sets include various sizes of screwdriver and usually a case.
category_name.fr_FR: tournevis manuels et sets de tournevis

category_description.en_US: Device with various separable microphones to listen to other rooms e.g. a baby alarm which parents/carers use to listen to a sleeping baby.
A socket and tool set contains a ratchet tool and a series of detachable sockets for tightening and loosening nuts of different sizes.
Device for inhaling something, such as a respirator or inhaler.
A washing machine with an inbuilt tumble dryer, so clothes can be washed and dried.
category_name.fr_FR: machines à laver avec sèche linge

category_description.en_US: Cooking appliance, or the flat top part of a cooker, with hotplates or burners.
Machine with a rapidly rotating container that applies centrifugal force to its contents, typically to separate fluids of different densities (e.g. cream from milk) or liquids from solids.
Chairs and stools for camping.
Machine with a mechanically driven needle for sewing or stitching cloth.
Collection of speakers in a home audio system.
Device comprising both a transmitter and a receiver which are used in computer networks.

Sspecial loudspeaker enclosure that creates a reasonable stereo effect from a single cabinet. They are much wider than they are tall, partly for acoustical reasons, but also so that they can be mounted above or below a display device e.g. above a computer monitor or under a television or home theater screen.
Small structure in a public area used for providing information, often incorporating an interactive display screen or screens.
Portable electrical apparatus that by means of suction collects dust and small particles from floors and other surfaces.
Upright unit comprising a refrigerator and a freezer, each self-contained.
Electronic device that receives radio waves and converts the information carried by them to a usable form. It is used with an antenna.
Portable electric jigsaw.

Specialised power tool used for cutting narrow grooves in walls, for instance when laying electrical cable. The tool is usually powered by an electric motor which drives a pair of abrasive discs like those found in an angle grinder, positioned closely together.
Devices which have both radios and CD players.

Type of benchtop grinding machine used to drive abrasive wheels. A pedestal grinder is a larger version of a bench grinder that is mounted on a pedestal, which is bolted to the floor. These types of grinders are commonly used to hand grind cutting tools and perform other rough grinding.
Tool designed to spin a grinding stone or sanding disk to remove material, usually metal, and finish a surface.
Powerful tools used to drill large holes in thick wood etc.
Power-driven cutting tool with teeth set on a chain which moves around the edge of a blade, used for cutting down trees, hedges etc.
Tool used to cut hedges, which is powered by a battery or battery pack and can operate without a power cord or cable attached to a fixed electricity supply.
Tools used in the home and garden such as power drills, spades and screwdrivers.
category_name.fr_FR: outils de jardin à main et électrique

category_description.en_US: Tool that has a power source, usually electricity, to make the tools more effective than their manual equivalents. Common examples are power drills and power saws used in construction.
Electrical tools that are powered by a battery or battery pack and can operate without a power cord or cable attached to a fixed electricity supply. This allows greater mobility.
Tools that contain or are operated by air or gas under pressure.
Devices which use IR (Infra Red) to soothe muscles, heal injuries etc.
Small handheld beauty device which uses a heated element to curl hair.

Tool with a flattened or cross-shaped tip that fits into the head of a screw to turn it, which is powered by a battery or battery pack and can operate without a power cord or cable attached to a fixed electricity supply.

Tool with a rotating cutting tip or reciprocating hammer or chisel, used for making holes. Powered by a battery or battery pack and can operate without a power cord or cable attached to a fixed electricity supply.

Tool shaped like a gun which applies hot melted adhesive (glue) to a surface which dries in a short time. Powered by a battery or battery pack and can operate without a power cord or cable attached to a fixed electricity supply.
Mobile phone that is able to perform many of the functions of a computer, typically having a relatively large screen and an operating system capable of running general-purpose applications.

Electronic amplifier that amplifies low-power audio signals (signals composed primarily of frequencies between 20 - 20 000 Hz, the human range of hearing) to a level suitable for driving loudspeakers and is the final stage in a typical audio playback chain.

Saw with a fine blade enabling it to cut curved lines in a sheet of wood, metal, or plastic. Powered by a battery or battery pack and can operate without a power cord or cable attached to a fixed electricity supply.
Portable electric jigsaw, powered by a battery or battery pack and can operate without a power cord or cable attached to a fixed electricity supply.
DVD/Blu-Ray players that can are lightweight and portable. Some have an integral screen, others need to be attached to an external monitor.

Also called "combi drills," these are very powerful tools which move the drill bit in and out while it is spinning. Used in demolition work. Powered by a battery or battery pack and can operate without a power cord or cable attached to a fixed electricity supply.
Power saw with a rapidly rotating toothed disc. Powered by a battery or battery pack and can operate without a power cord or cable attached to a fixed electricity supply.

Tool with a rotating abrasive disc, used to grind, polish, or cut metal and other materials. Powered by a battery or battery pack and can operate without a power cord or cable attached to a fixed electricity supply.

Tool used in gardening, carpenty and construction for cutting various materials. Powered by a battery or battery pack and can operate without a power cord or cable attached to a fixed electricity supply.
Tool which fastens or fixes things in place with tacks. Powered by a battery or battery pack and can operate without a power cord or cable attached to a fixed electricity supply.
These are places where steam irons are placed to produce the steam.
Flat cable with a PATA interface, used to connect storage devices such as hard disks, floppy drives, and optical disc drives in computers.
Cream or substance applied to the face to give the skin a brown tinge (fake tan).
Devices which distribute audio and video signals over long distances.
A nailer is a device for putting nails into wood. A pneumatic nailer is the most common type of power nail guns. They are powered by air pressure from a small compressor, and are quick ansd powerful.
Tool for shaping wood. They are used to flatten, reduce the thickness of, and impart a smooth surface to a rough piece of lumber or timber.
Components of a computer case.
A drive bay is a standard area for adding hardware to a computer. Most drive bays are fixed to the inside of a case, but some can be removed.
Fridges that also have freezer departments, usually at the top.
Fridges and freezers that stand next to each other in the kitchen.
